instructions: Open Google Play Store on your digital device, whether that is a tablet, an Android Phone, or a computer. Pretending to Pay for a Paid App In the Google Play Store, pretend like you will purchase a paid app . In fact, you can choose any paid app. On the screen that follows, push Continue until you get to see the Payment methods screen. Remember not to proceed with payment. Just close the Google Play Store. Open the Settings app on the same device. Choose Applications on the Settings screen. Tap on Application Manager on the next screen (the Applications screen). Tap on Google Play Store on the screen that follows. On the next screen, tap on the Clear Data (or Clear Cache) button first, and then tap on the Force Stop button. Sometimes, this is the Quit button. Clear Data and Force Stop Must Read : What to Do to Clear Android Cache Open the Google Play Store on your device and tap on the Accept button if they ask you to Accept Google Play Terms of Service.

Open the Google Play Store on your Android Phone and proceed with the installation of the Turbo VPN app, or any VPN app that you desire to install and use. Turbo VPN Installation Once you finish downloading the app, open it on your device. As soon as the app opens, look for the world icon on the top right corner and tap on it. Tapping on the World Icon Check out the next screen and choose the country from the dropdown list. Tap on the country that you want to set your Google Play Store too. If your country does not appear on the list, then you might need Express VPN app on your device. Express VPN is available for more countries. Must Read : Best Free VPN Apps for Android On the next screen, tap on OK and wait until your App has established a VPN connection. Waiting for the App to Establish a VPN Connection One of the VPN connection has been established, open Google Play Store on your device and follow the directions in Method 1.

Update your Address in Google Payments. First, you need to open the Google Play Store on your device. Next, tap on the icon from the top left corner so that you can see a drop-down menu. Tapping on the 3-line Icon to Expose the Menu Choose Account, then choose Payment methods. Add your current credit card to this option if you do not have any payment method yet. When you reach the next screen, find the More Payment Settings tab and tap on it. More Payment Settings Tab On the following screen where you can see the Google Payment Center, sign into your original Google Account . Must Read : 5 Top Notch Password Manager Android Apps to Be Safe After doing so, tap once again on the three-line icon on the top left corner of your Payments Center screen. Tapping on the 3-line icon at Payments Center. Tap on Settings along the slide-over menu. Tapping on the Settings on the Slide Over Menu Icon Once you are on the Settings screen, tap on the pencil icon right next to Country. Then choose your new country. As soon as a Pop-up comes out, click on Got It. Next, type your New Address and save this information by tapping on Save. In case it says error, then quit Google Play Store and perform the same steps all over again. Still, if there is an error, use a different device and perform the same steps. Open your browser . Proceed to Google Wallet. Using the Google Wallet App Must Read: Android Pay vs. Google Wallet: A Difference in Handling your Money Proceed to Settings. Type in a new home address. As you have removed the old address, proceed to the Address Book Tab. You can see your old address there. Delete that address. When you see a prompt window that opens after you remove your old address, click on Accept when asked to accept terms and conditions which are specific for the new country. Using your Android device, go to the App menu and tap on the Settings icon. Proceed to Apps. Locate the Google Play Store App. Then tap on Clear Data or Clear Cache. After doing this, you will now see Google Play Store matching your default country. Tapping on Google Play Store Click on Clear Data and Force Stop on the screen that follows. Open Google Play Store again and click Accept when asked about the Terms and Conditions. Must Read: Google Pay vs. Samsung Pay: Which One Is Right for You?
